intro: Hieracium ornatum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Hieracium ornatum is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
